page.title: 13LICHFIELD CHURCH
page.content: {St.Michael's Church} stands on Greenhill overlooking the city and is said to be on the site of one of the five ancient burial grounds in England. The church dates from the twelth century. The church has a large part to play in the city of Lichfield.A Civic service is held there each year and also a memorial service for Samuel Johnson who was born in the city.The Rector and Deaconess also carry out a full programme of the usual Parish activities;catering for a Parish of about 1000.This includes regular visits to St.Michael's Hospital. St.Michael's School has a very close association with St.Michael's Church. Every week school services are held there as well as the school Carol Service and other Services.The school also raises money for the Church.
